intro: Mikania euryanthela, commonly known as the broad-flowered Mikania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in inflorescences, which are typically arranged in a corymb. Mikania euryanthela is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings, where it thrives in full sun.
